result.execSummary:
The defendant Jevonte D Carney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges associated with DV charge, including the assessment to be paid within 4 months. If defendant fails to pay costs and surcharges by that time it will convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the injunction which is in effect until 2017. Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jevonte D Carney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jevonte Carney in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
District attorney informs the court that they have not received a copy of the Injunction.
Defense motion to dismiss denied by the court.
Case passed....
Later same day, same appearances..
As to count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. 
Sentencing continued...
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by victim.

  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 138 days time served.  Time served dispositon.
 Defendant ordered to pay all costs and surcharges associated with DV charge, including the assessment.  Defendant to pay the costs within 4 months.  If defendant fails to pay the costs and surcharges by that time it will convert to a civil judgment.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief,  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the injunction which is in effect until 2017.
Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Notice and Motion for Reduction of Bail.
Due to Speedy Trial Demand time limits, and state's request for an adjournment of the Jury Trial date. Court set bail in the amount of $500.00 Signature Bond.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Jevonte D Carney not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. State not prepared to proceed today, requests an adjournment to obtain certified documents. Discussion regarding Speedy Trail Demand. Defense motion to Dismiss argued, DENIED. Court GRANTED adjournment and set matter for Jury Trial.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Jevonte D Carney not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 6/17/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail. Case set for a bail Bond Hearing on 5/7/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Jevonte D Carney not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  State's offer is open until 1 week prior to Jury Trial date. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 06/17/2015.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Jevonte D Carney not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date. Court denied and set case for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Inesha W or her children
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jevonte D Carney in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  
Defendant Jevonte D Carney in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
